task_summary: Perceive the green bottle, approach and align with it, then push it laterally on the tabletop and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a UR-style manipulator above a white tabletop with several objects arranged in a row: a small green bottle on the left, colored containers in the middle, and a taller red bottle on the right. The instruction is to move the green bottle. We interpret this as a lateral push on the table surface without grasping. The robot first detects and verifies the target, approaches while keeping the gripper open, aligns to the bottle, pushes it a short distance, and then retreats to a safe height.
preconditions: Robot is homed and within workspace limits
Table surface is clear for a short lateral push
Green bottle stands upright and is movable by contact
stepwise_plan: Move to pre-push pose above target
Open gripper to avoid unintended grasp
Approach and align to contact line
Push bottle 10 cm along table x-axis (0°)
success_criteria: Green bottle has a clearly different lateral position on the table
No collision with other objects beyond gentle contact
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-run detection or scan area
If alignment fails or slip occurs, retreat slightly and re-approach
If push is obstructed, reduce distance and try a smaller push
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after a single successful push followed by a retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Run perception to find the green bottle.
Move to a prepush waypoint above the bottle.
Verify the bottle is still visible.
Keep gripper open to push without grasping.
Approach and align contact line with the bottle.
Push the bottle 10 cm along table x-axis (0°).
Back off to a safe distance after the push.

recovery_strategy: Re-run detection or perform a scan
Retreat and re-approach with tighter tolerance
assumptions: Interpreted 'move' as a lateral push on the tabletop, not a pick-and-place
Direction 0° aligns with table +x (left-to-right in frames)
Frames show the end-effector near the green bottle consistent with a push motion

expected_success_criteria: Bottle final position differs by ~10 cm from start
Robot ends without contact and with no toppled objects
